data.title: 19 Men Of Afghanistan In Art Image: PICRYL
data.meta_description: Download Images of Men Of Afghanistan In Art - Free for commercial use, no attribution required. From: A Dooraunee Villager with his Arms to {{to}.
data.text:
"A Dooraunee Villager with his Arms," 1815* (Ames Library) "In Mountstuart Elphinstone, 'An Account of the Kingdom of Caubul, and its dependencies in Persia, Tartary, and India' (London: Longman, Hurst, Rees, More

City of Kandahar, with main bazaar and citadel, Afghanistan. Coloured lithograph by R. Carrick after Lieutenant James Rattray, c. 1847. Iconographic Collections Keywords: James Rattray; Robert Carrick

Two-panel cartoon in, Ghimpele, the Romanian satirical magazine; a local perspective on the Second Anglo-Afghan War and the difficulties encountered by the British Empire. British PM Benjamin Disraeli, portray More

Afghans, a painting by Alexandre Iacovleff Public domain photograph of 20th-century painting, free to use, no copyright restrictions image - Picryl description

Afghaun foot soldiers in their winter dress, with entrance to the Valley of Urgundeh This lithograph was taken from plate 11 of 'Afghaunistan' by Lieutenant James Rattray. During the severe winters, Afghanis wo More

Jaunbauz, or Afghan cavalry, with horse, bearing implements for smoking This lithograph is taken from plate 17 of 'Afghaunistan' by Lieutenant James Rattray. He wrote: "Never were a wilder, more devil-may-care More

Gool Mahommed Khaun, King of the Ghiljyes This lithograph is taken from plate 25 of 'Afghaunistan' by Lieutenant James Rattray. On 29 September 1841, Sir Alexander Burnes allowed Rattray to meet a prisoner of s More

Hawkers of Ko-i-staun, with Valley of Caubul and Mountains of Hindoocoosh This lithograph is taken from plate 4 of 'Afghaunistan' by Lieutenant James Rattray. In September 1841 Rattray sketched two men from Ko More

Khoja Padshauh, a Ko-i-staun chief, with his armed retainers This lithograph is taken from plate 7 of 'Afghaunistan' by Lieutenant James Rattray. Together with his brother's regiment, Rattray went on a reconnoi More

Ko-i-staun foot soldiery in summer costume This lithograph is taken from plate 12 of 'Afghaunistan' by Lieutenant James Rattray. This Kohistani is Mir Alam, formerly one of a band of noted robbers on the road t More

Meerz Fyze, an Oosbeg Elchee or Ambassador This lithograph is taken from plate 22 of 'Afghaunistan' by Lietenant James Rattray. In September 1840, the British were in negotiations with Mir Wali, prince of the f More
